I wouldn't say that. Themes have theme wide styling controls, the concept of theme modules and theme templates. Theme modules visually stand out in the add module panel when editing a page. When creating a page, content creators are presented with a grid of themes, they choose the theme they are creating a page for, and just those templates get displayed. Providing an easier content editor experience.

Also while not explicitly tied to themes, a theme is significantly more likely to have dnd areas.
I think we need to able to add search box module to custom modules
if we make header as custom module, can't insert search box into header. only able to do via javascript
